F

Firedanger - Class in tu.berkebile.science
Includes methods to determine seven indexes used in the past by the Forest Service (US Department of Agriculture) to characterize the danger of forest fire spread: Fine fuel moisture: represents the moisture content of litter (forest material that can burn) measured in %. Adjusted fuel moisture: Fine fuel moisture adjusted for precipitation in the last day. Drying factor: ranges between 1 an 7 (inversely proportional to ffm) Buildup index: reflecting the combined cumulative effects of daily drying and precipitation in fuels (such as dead vegetation) with a 10 day time lag constant Fine fuel spread: fire spread danger for grass fuel environments (measured in %) Timber spread index: predicts the relative forward spread of fire burning in a comparatively closed environment under a timber canopy (measured in %). Fire load index: rating of the maximum effort required to contain all probable fires (most fires occur when fli ~= 70).
Firedanger() - Constructor for class tu.berkebile.science.Firedanger
Instantiates a new instance of Firedanger.
